hw1

Class Printer

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw1.Printer

  • public class Printer
extends java.lang.Object
    A simple printer class to model ink and paper usage.
    Author:
    Aaron

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double INK_CAPACITY
      Amount in ounces of ink, in a new cartridge.
      static double INK_USAGE
      Amount of ink in ounces used per printed page.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Printer(int givenCapacity)
      Creates a new printer with the given paper tray capacity, no paper and a full ink cartridge.
      Printer(int givenCapacity, int givenNumberOfSheets)
      Creates a new printer with the given paper tray capacity and an initial load of paper equal to the givenNumberOfSheets and with a full ink cartridge.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addPaper(int additionalSheets)
      Adds paper to the paper tray not to exceed the paper capacity
      int getCurrentPaper()
      Gets the current amount of paper in the tray, this is never negative (duh)
      int getTotalPaperUse()
      Gets the total number of sheets of paper that the printer has used since its construction
      boolean isInkOut()
      Determines if the ink is out Ink is considered out when the current ink level is less than the amount of ink required to print one sheet of paper.
      void print(int numberOfPages)
      Simulates printing pages in one-sided mode If there isn't enough paper to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining paper and the corresponding amount of ink If there isn't enough ink to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining ink, but still prints the original number of sheets, but the sheets after the ink runs out will be blank.
      void printTwoSided(int numberOfPages)
      Simulates printing pages in two-sided mode If there isn't enough paper to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining paper and the corresponding amount of ink If there isn't enough ink to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining ink, but still prints the original number of sheets, but the sheets after the ink runs out will be blank.
      void replaceInk()
      Simulates the replacement of the ink Cartridge, returns the cartridgeLevel to INK_CAPACITY.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • INK_CAPACITY

        public static final double INK_CAPACITY
        Amount in ounces of ink, in a new cartridge.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INK_USAGE

        public static final double INK_USAGE
        Amount of ink in ounces used per printed page.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • Printer

        public Printer(int givenCapacity)
        Creates a new printer with the given paper tray capacity, no paper and a full ink cartridge.
        Parameters:
        givenCapacity - The maximum amount of paper that the paper tray can contain.

      • Printer

        public Printer(int givenCapacity,
               int givenNumberOfSheets)
        Creates a new printer with the given paper tray capacity and an initial load of paper equal to the givenNumberOfSheets and with a full ink cartridge.
        Parameters:
        givenCapacity - The maximum amount of paper that the paper tray can hold
        givenNumberOfSheets - The initial amount of paper in the paper tray

    • Method Detail

      • addPaper

        public void addPaper(int additionalSheets)
        Adds paper to the paper tray not to exceed the paper capacity
        Parameters:
        additionalSheets - The number of sheets of paper to add

      • getCurrentPaper

        public int getCurrentPaper()
        Gets the current amount of paper in the tray, this is never negative (duh)
        Returns:
        Returns the current amount of paper in the tray.

      • getTotalPaperUse

        public int getTotalPaperUse()
        Gets the total number of sheets of paper that the printer has used since its construction
        Returns:
        Returns the total number of sheets of paper that the printer has used.

      • isInkOut

        public boolean isInkOut()
        Determines if the ink is out Ink is considered out when the current ink level is less than the amount of ink required to print one sheet of paper.
        Returns:
        Returns a boolean flag indicating whether the ink is out, or not.

      • replaceInk

        public void replaceInk()
        Simulates the replacement of the ink Cartridge, returns the cartridgeLevel to INK_CAPACITY.

      • print

        public void print(int numberOfPages)
        Simulates printing pages in one-sided mode If there isn't enough paper to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining paper and the corresponding amount of ink If there isn't enough ink to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining ink, but still prints the original number of sheets, but the sheets after the ink runs out will be blank.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPages - Number of pages to print

      • printTwoSided

        public void printTwoSided(int numberOfPages)
        Simulates printing pages in two-sided mode If there isn't enough paper to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining paper and the corresponding amount of ink If there isn't enough ink to complete the job, the printer uses the remaining ink, but still prints the original number of sheets, but the sheets after the ink runs out will be blank.
        Parameters:
        numberOfPages - Number of pages to print
